sentence.text: Familial hypercholesterolemia is usually due to loss-of-function mutations in intestinal cholesterol absorption, the gene coding for low density lipoprotein receptor and genes encoding for proteins that interact with the receptor: positive regulation of macrophage derived foam cell differentiation, negative regulation of receptor recycling and LDLRAP1.

entity.text: positive regulation of macrophage derived foam cell differentiation

sentence.text: Monogenic hypertriglyceridemia is the result of mutations in genes that regulate the metabolism of triglyceride rich lipoproteins (eg fatty acid metabolic process, positive regulation of phospholipase activity, triglyceride metabolic process, triglyceride metabolic process, positive regulation of lipoprotein lipase activity).

entity.text: positive regulation of lipoprotein lipase activity

sentence.text: Conversely familial hypobetalipoproteinemia is caused by inactivation of the negative regulation of receptor recycling gene which increases the number of LDL receptors and decreases plasma cholesterol.
